sources.text: p.115. 1807. Whereas Isaac Bonsall of Uwchlan Township in the County of Chester in the state of Pennsylvania son of Edward Bonsall of the city of Philadelphia... and Hannah his wife, and Mary Newbold daughter of John Hoskins of the City of Burlington... having declared their intentions of marriage with each other... this fifth day of the eleventh month in the year of our Lord one thousand and eight hundred and seven...
sources.citation: Burlington Monthly Meeting, Burlington Monthly Meeting, via Ancestry.com search, July 20 2021.

sources.text: p.64. 1791. Whereas Samuel Newbold of the Township of Chesterfield in the County of Burlington and Western Division of the State of New Jersey, son of John and Mary Newbold... and Mary Hoskins daughter of John and Mary Hoskins of the city of Burlington... having declared their intentions of marriage with each other... this fifteenth day of the ninth month the year of our Lord on thousand seven hundred and ninety one...
sources.citation: Burlington Monthly Meeting, Burlington Monthly Meeting, via Ancestry.com search, July 20 2021.

sources.text: p.107. The children of John and Mary Hoskins wth. said Mary is daughter to Joshua and Sarah Raper; Sarah; Raper; Ruth; Joseph; Lydia; John; Mary Hoskins born the 9th of 5th mo 1765, married Newbold, afterward to Isaac Bonsall; Rachel; Thomas; Caleb; Abigail
sources.citation: Burlington Monthly Meeting, Register [copy], 1675-1805,  via Ancestry.com search, July 20 2021.

sources.text: p.12. Daughter of John and Mary Hoskins and widow of Samuel Newbold of Mansfield; Mary Newbold her daughter Martha Newbold; born at 5 mo 9th 1765 in 1791 and removed with her husband to Upper Springfield after his death with her daughter...; March 11th 1807 to Issac Bonsall; Deceased 7 mo 24 1814
sources.citation: Burlington Monthly Meeting, Membership, 1805-1832, via Ancestry.com search, July 20 2021.

biogHists.text: Mary Hoskins Newbould Bonsall was a Quaker associated with Burlington Monthly Meeting. She was born on the 9th of the 5th month 1765 to John and Mary (Raper) Hoskins. In 1791 she married Samuel Newbold of the Township of Chesterfield in the County of Burlington, son of John and Mary Newbold. In 1807, she remarried to widower Isaac Bonsall, first superintendent of Friends Hospital, of Uwchlawn Township, son of Edward. She was the sister-in-law of John Griscom, Thomas Scattergood, and Joseph Richardson, whose son Nathaniel married Hannah Yarnall, daughter of Peter Yarnall and Hannah Haines Thornton Yarnall. She died on July 24, 1814.

relations.note: Joseph Richardson's son Nathaniel married Hannah Yarnall, daughter of Peter Yarnall and Hannah Haines Thornton Yarnall.

resource.title: John Hunt papers, 1770-1828.
resource.abstract: John Hunt kept a diary for more than 40 years, recording Quaker concerns and daily events. This collections consists primarily of the manuscript journal, 1770-1800; fragments of 1805, 1806 & 1808; and 1814-1824. Of particular interest are the visits of prominent Quakers, including Elias Hicks and Jonathan Evans. There is also an account book, some correspondence received, and other miscellaneous materials. Correspondents include Ann R. Matlack, Asa Matlack, Elizabeth A. Lippincott, John Cox, Joseph Foulke, and Josiah Roberts.

nameEntries.original: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College
